page.title: 05Upper Clatford village
page.content: The village is very spread out and appears quiet and sleepy, but this is not so. Old thatched cottages blend with flint, tiled cottages and new houses are interspaced. Warden controlled bungalows are amongst the latest development along with a new estate of private houses. There is a church and a chapel in the village. The Memorial Hall is used for many village activities including: Playgroup, Dog Training, Friendship Club for the elderly, Bingo (twice a month), Whist Drives, Soft Furnishing classes and the Women's Institute meet there once a month. The village pub is the{Crook and {Shears.}It is always busy and serves bar meals. There is a skittle alley. The village holds a May Fayre and Flea Market which lasts for two days.
